moves.1. d4: Oliver, overall you played an excellent game.  I will make some comments.
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. g3 c6: This wasn't the best move, but just to take you out of book.  Better move would be any of a few Bishop moves, such as a fianchetto, Bb4, etc.  This is not a suicidal move, just not the best.
moves.5. Bg2 Be7 6. O-O O-O 7. Bf4 d5 8. Nbd2: I think this is the turning point in the game.  My rule is to never initiate a trade without a good reason.  I can't read your mind, so you may have had a good reason that just didn't work out. But from the time you gave me control over this file, you will note that you lose the use of your Queen for the rest of the game.
Notice how your Queen is constantly threatened or blocked due to the early Queen exposure and the Bishop file.
moves.26... Qa7 27. e3 g5 28. Be5 Ng4 29. Bh3: Bh3 only forces me to do what I wanted, to trade a weak Knight for a strong Bishop.  Bf1 would have at least put a small pressure on b5.
moves.29... Nxe5 30. dxe5 d4 31. e4: This move surrenders control to me and misses a potential attack.  a3 chases my Knight and if followed with Bxe6, Qg6+, Qxh6+, etc. has possibilities.  But notice, that the Queen cannot make that move because of this move e4 which blocks the Queen's path.
moves.32... Na6 33. f4 b4 34. Bf1: a4 doesn't stop the attack but, would slightly slow it.  After this move it is over.  BxN is no threat to my attack.  Everything follows from here and doesn't matter any more.
